text.section: When the declaration and bylaws are recorded, the developer shall record a condominium plat.
Each unit shall be designated on the condominium plat by a letter or number, or a combination of them, or other appropriate designation.

A condominium plat or any amendment to a condominium plat is sufficient for the purposes of this title if there is attached to, or included in it, a certificate of a professional land surveyor or property line surveyor authorized to practice in the State that:
The plat, together with the applicable wording of the declaration, is a correct representation of the condominium described; and
The identification and location of each unit and the common elements, as constructed, can be determined from them.

section.section: Except as provided in paragraph (2) of this subsection or otherwise provided in this title, the condominium plat may be amended in the same manner and to the same extent as the declaration under § 11-103(c)(1) of this title.
The council of unit owners may petition the circuit court in equity for the county in which the condominium is located to correct an improper description of the units or common elements.
The petition may be brought only if:
The court may reform the condominium plat to correct the error or omission as the court considers appropriate, if:

A final order of reformation may be appealed by any party within 30 days of its issuance. An order of reformation may not be recorded until the appeal period has lapsed or all appeals have been completed.

An amendment or order of reformation becomes effective upon recordation in the same manner as the condominium plat. If the condominium is registered with the Secretary of State, the council of unit owners shall file a copy of the reformation amendment with the Secretary of State within 15 days of recordation.
